1    EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:



?    California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

?    Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

?    California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

?    Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Golden Sierra Cold Storage has elected to use PSMWriter©, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1    GOLDEN SIERRA COLD STORAGE, RISK & PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM 



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Golden Sierra Cold Storage has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which has the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Ammonia Refrigeration | Ammonia | 14,000 lb



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.



Golden Sierra Cold Storage has an exemplary safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. We have: 



1.    Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan

to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2.    Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general Golden Sierra Cold Storage business practices

3.    Utilized PSMWriter© software to ensure that all necessary Golden Sierra Cold Storage employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees protect themselves and our neighbors.



1.2    PROCESS DESCRIPTION



Golden Pacific Cold Storage is a commercial cold storage facility for table grapes.  The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to five (5) cold storage rooms and one (1) hallway/dock.  The cold storage rooms are equipped with spiral fin bunker coils, while the dock has two (2) ceiling suspended coil.  Both kinds of coils contain chilled liquid ammonia.



The system operates as follows: high pressure liquid from a high pressure receiver is piped to each cold room where it passes through a solenoid valve, an expansion valve, and into a low pressure accumulator vessel mounted inside the bunkers.  Low temperature liquid circulates by thermal convection through the evaporator coils located behind bunker walls in the cold rooms.  Low pressure and temperature gas collects in the accumulator vessel, and passes through a pressure regulator into a suction line.  The suction line returns the vapor to the main suction accumulator vessel located in the engine room, which separates any residual liquid from the gas.  The gas is piped to reciprocating and upright compressors which elevate the temperature and pressure of the gas.  The high pressure discharge from the compressors is sent to water cooled evaporative condensers where the high pressure gas ammonia is liquefied and returned to the high pressure receiver. Liquid separated from the suction return gas in the main suction accumulator vessel drains into a liquid transfer vessel.  Operation of a float switch

activated solenoid valve raises the pressure in the liquid transfer vessel to the point the liquid can be drained into the high pressure receiver.  



The system contains numerous safety devices including sensors which stop the compressors if temperatures or pressures exceed or drop below established limits, and safety relief valves which vent ammonia gas to the atmosphere if the pressure in the system exceeds their set point.  



The ammonia system at this facility consists of vessels which are interconnected, or which are co-located such that a release of ammonia could impact the ability to operate vessels that are not directly connected.  Therefore, the system is treated as a single process.



1.3    GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



1.3.1    GENERAL 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Golden Sierra Cold Storage has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in the body of the program. 



1.3.2    ANHYDROUS AMMONIA



The ammonia refrigeration process at the Golden Sierra Cold Storage facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.



Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active log book of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one

of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 



1.4    FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Golden Sierra Cold Storage has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5    EMERGENCY ACTION AND RESPONSE PLAN



Golden Sierra Cold Storage's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:



?    California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

?    Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Our company has an outstanding safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Many policies and procedures have been implemented to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Golden Sierra Cold Storage continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter© software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Golden Sierra Cold Storage's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter© tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Golden Sierra Cold Storage's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Golden Sierra Cold Storage has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event ar

e entered into PSMWriter©, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter© as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter©.



In addition to utilizing PSMWriter© to create, schedule, track, and document events, Golden Sierra Cold Storage has also entered into a contract with California Controlled Atmosphere to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation. A copy of California Controlled Atmosphere's service agreement has been included in this program with the support material.



For the future, Golden Sierra Cold Storage now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Golden Sierra Cold Storage employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Golden Sierra Cold Storage will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
